intro: Stenogrammitis hildebrandtii, commonly known as the Hildebrandt's stenogrammitis, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth form and is typically found in rocky or shaded environments. The plant has a dark green to reddish-brown coloration, with leaf cells that are often elongated and papillose. It is primarily distributed in temperate regions of the Southern Hemisphere, including South America and Australia. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and often elusive species among mosses.
